Lavendeux

  • Extensions
  • Report a Problem

CTRL-Space to evaluate expressions from anywhere.

These extensions come with Lavendeux

Programming

  • Added in 0.5.0
    complement ( color )
    Arguments
    A hexadecimal color code (eg, 0xFF00FF)
    Returns
    The complementary color code
    Note
    Best used with the @h, @hex, or @hexadecimal decorators
  • Added in 0.5.0
    regex ( regex, value )
    Arguments
    A regular expression, and a string
    Returns
    The first match for regex in value
    Note
    Uses Python regex syntax
  • Added in 0.5.0
    strlen ( string )
    Arguments
    A string
    Returns
    The number of characters in the string
  • Added in 0.5.0
    tail ( filename, max_lines )
    Arguments
    A string filename, and an optional maximum number of lines
    Returns
    Up to max_lines from the end of the file, or many complete lines as possible up to 4095 characters
  • Added in 0.5.0
    unixtime ()
    Arguments
    None
    Returns
    The current unix timestamp
  • Added in 0.5.0
    @unixtime
    Effect
    Formats a unix timestamp into human readable format
  • Added in 0.5.0
    urldecode ( string )
    Arguments
    A urlencoded string
    Returns
    The string, decoded
  • Added in 0.5.0
    urlencode ( string )
    Arguments
    A string
    Returns
    The string, urlencoded

Networking

  • Added in 0.5.0
    hostname ( address )
    Arguments
    An IP address, in string format
    Returns
    The FQDN associated to that IP, or the IP on failure
    Note
    500ms timeout
  • Added in 0.5.0
    ping ( address )
    Arguments
    An IP address, or FQDN in string format
    Returns
    The number of milliseconds needed to ping the target, in ms
    Note
    Only works if Lavendeux is started as administrator, 500ms timeout
  • Added in 0.5.0
    resolve ( address )
    Arguments
    A FQDN
    Returns
    The IP address associated with hostname, or the hostname on failure
    Note
    500ms timeout
  • Added in 0.5.0
    wget ( address )
    Arguments
    A url string
    Returns
    Up to 4095 characters from a plaintext resource at url
    Note
    Assumes HTTP if not specified, 500ms timeout

Randomization

  • Added in 0.5.0
    choose ( ... )
    Arguments
    Any number of any combination of types
    Returns
    One of its arguments at random
  • Added in 0.5.0
    rand ()
    Arguments
    None
    Returns
    A random floating point between 0 and 1
  • Added in 0.5.0
    rand ( min, max )
    Arguments
    2 integers defining inclusive range
    Returns
    A random integer inside that range

Language

  • Added in 0.5.1
    synonym ( word, type )
    Arguments
    A word, and an option descriptor (eg: noun or verb)
    Returns
    A random synonym of the same type as word, if specified
    Note
    To use this, please get an API key from here and add it to apis.py. Only 1000 total requests per day can be made on the API key used to demonstrate the feature

Misc

  • Added in 0.5.0
    pokedex ( pokemon )
    Arguments
    A pokemon's name as a string, or its pokedex number
    Returns
    The pokedex number for that name, or the name for that pokedex number
    Note
    Pokemon, Pokedex and all other related names are the sole property of the Pokemon Company

Building extensions

Extensions are written in python, and placed in the extensions directory, wherever Lavendeux was installed. They are called by the name of the module in which they are placed, eg: ping.py is called with ping()

Below is a simple example of an extension that adds 2 numbers, and can be used as a decorator.

For more in depth information about extensions, click here

from lavendeux import Types, Errors

def call(args):
        # Check number of arguments
        if len(args) != 2:
            return (Types.ERROR, Errors.INVALID_ARGS)

        # Return answer
    return (Types.FLOAT, args[0] + args[1])

def decorate(value):
        return "Decorated!"

def help():
    return "Help message"
